reviews.text: It was our first time to Istanbul and we stayed in Kupeli hotel because of the location and reviews we had read about it. It was nothing short of AMAZING.
reviews.title: AMAZING - RECOMMENDED

reviews.text: The location in the old city is perfect. It is walking distance from the Grand Bazaar and all of the attractions located in the old city of Istanbul.
reviews.title: A Find in Istanbul

reviews.text: The staff (Mahir and Ozgur and others) were very friendly and understood English and helped us figuring out where to go in our free time and with the transportation.
reviews.title: Kupeli Hotel is a jewel within the Old City!

reviews.text: The rooms and bathrooms are very clean and tidy and they have a typical turkish style which is very sweet. The breakfast buffet is very generous, you can find anything you are craving for as a breakfast.
reviews.title: Very friendly Staff

reviews.text: This hotel is really recommended. It is perfect in all ways.
reviews.title: Amazing trip

reviews.text: We arrived during renovation, so it got better each day! Everyone was so friendly, the staff could not do enough for you, even when I forgot some important tablets, the reception staff organised for a friend to take me to a chemist nearby and translate what I wanted. The rooms were clean, the breakfast suited everyone's tastes. There will be teething problems but the staff need to know what they are to address them. it's a big change from what we expected on the picutre of the old hotel on the internet. Plus you get to step out into a film set right outside the front door - Coronation Street in Istanbul!
reviews.title: A LOVELY FRIENDLY HOTEL

reviews.text: Don't miss out on Cozy Pub/Restaurant either - they have a spectacular rooftop restaurant.... We will return! Alan, Michele, Josh and Tom Finch

reviews.text: The hotel pretends to be 4 star, I would say it's 2! The service was just horrible-horrible!

First of all the blow dryer was sparking, we asked to have it replaced or fixed and got the promise from the receptionist that it will be done next day. As we returned back to the room next day in the afternoon we found out the broken death-carrying blow dryer was still there. The receptionist told us angrily that it was Sunday and there was not much he could do. So why saying they would take care of it in the first place?! They ended up giving us a very old portable blow dryer.
reviews.title: Nice and cozy hotel

reviews.text: Next thing: the towel ring. It was broken as we moved in and never got fixed either so we had to keep hand towel on the sink.
